channel.title: google cloud platform on Stéphane Fréchette
channel.description: Recent content in google cloud platform on Stéphane Fréchette

item.title: Datascape Podcast - August Cloud Update
item.description: I sat down with my friends on the Datascape Podcast to discuss latest cloud updates. In this episode, Warner (Azure), yours truly -> Stephane (GCP), Pierig (AWS) and Chris discuss several interesting cloud updates released on the public cloud(s) over the last few months. Link to episode: Episode 36 - August Cloud Update Enjoy!

item.title: Creating a Google Cloud Platform service account key
item.description: Some context… A service account is a special type of Google account intended to represent a non-human user that needs to authenticate and be authorized to access data in Google APIs. Lately I have been helping customers that are using CDAP, an 100% open source, integrated framework that accelerates application development for data analytics. Specifically around creating and connecting to Google Cloud Storage as a source to ingest and do data preparation (a.

item.title: Deploying single instance SQL Server 2017 on GKE
item.description: Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration system for automating deployment, scaling and management of containerized applications. Running a SQL Server database on Kubernetes is a topic of discussion nowadays as Kubernetes provides ways to provision stateful containers using persistent volumes, statefulsets, etc. The following post is a tutorial we recently published on Google’s Partner Solutions that demonstrates how to provision a single instance of SQL Server 2017 on Linux on GKE using Regional persistent disks.

item.title: Recapping Google Next '19 with Stephane
item.description: I was invited to the Datascape Podcast by my friend and Team lead Chris Presley from Pythian to discuss and recap some of the interesting announcements at Google Next ‘19. Great discussions. I look forward to my next invitation! Link to episode: Episode 33 - Recapping Google Next 2019 with Stephane Enjoy!

item.title: Copying data to the Cloud from the Command line
item.description: Copying data to the Cloud from the Command line, this is what this post is all about. Over the last couple of years we have seen vendors offering different object storage platforms/services in the Cloud. Cloud storage typically refers to a hosted object storage service! The following are considered the most known and used Cloud Object Storage platforms and we are going to demonstrate how to copy data to each from the command line.
